intro: Erythrorhipsalis clavata, commonly known as the red-veined orchid, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves with deep red veins. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often arranged in a loose cluster. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in greenhouses and botanical gardens worldwide.
